messages.title: Dear Friend,
messages.content: On Monday the formal campaign for one of the most crucial General Elections in a generation will officially kick off. I am writing to you with an update on the campaigning work which we are doing locally to ensure that we elect a Labour government and to ask for your help.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Opposes the Tory led government's policies on the community, including the bedroom tax and mentions the impact on salaries and forcing residents into poverty.

mentions.tacticalSituation: A recent Lord Ashcroft poll showed just 1% difference in support between Labour and Lib Dems - we can definitely win this seat if we work hard.

issues.health: The impacts of the Tory led government's policies on our communities has been clear - our NHS is creaking at the seams; we have a housing crisis hitting even those on professional salaries.
issues.socialWelfare: The heartless reforms to our welfare system, including the bedroom tax, are forcing many of our poorest and most vulnerable residents further into poverty.

housing.content: We have a housing crisis hitting even those on professional salaries.

images.caption: Helen Hayes for Dulwich and West Norwood. Prospective Parliamentary Candidate

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet asks for help with the campaign by delivering leaflets, speaking to voters, running phone banks, and signing up for postal vote. Encourages to fill out a survey and to put up an enclosed poster to support the campaign.
